issue.title: (component) Clicking "Open in IDE" is broken

labels.name: stage: pending release
labels.description: There is a closed PR for this issue

issue.body:
### Current behavior

Clicking "Open in IDE"  in the reporter does not take user to hook/test definition that ran.

In Prod - this does nothing. It doesn't open the IDE or launch to the file that ran. See video:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14099737/197545580-7280e228-7018-438c-9077-436ece1fe3d0.mov

In dev - this opens to the current IDE / branch & opens the stack_utils file in the driver. See video:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14099737/197545624-5512a12a-2a74-43f4-b6e8-0e9d52aa2907.mov


### Desired behavior

Opens to hook / test when "Open in IDE" is clicked.

### Test code to reproduce

Open any CT test and click "Open in IDE" after test runs.

### Cypress Version

10.10.0

### Node version

16.16.0

### Operating System

MacOS 12.5.1

### Debug Logs

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

issue.title: Updated Migration UI for Cy 11+

labels.name: stage: pending release
labels.description: There is a closed PR for this issue

issue.body:
### What would you like?

We need to split out version specific content like "Welcome to Cypress 10!" from the information that users need to perform a migration before they they can launch the latest Cypress.

Designs are WIP but this would be a straight replacement of this screen in v10 with something more generic explaining the need to migrate:

![Screen Shot 2022-10-25 at 10 26 19 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8340719/197800785-a2310e73-579a-4725-88dc-7eb83e665cbc.png)


### Why is this needed?

The reason for this is that migration of `cypress.json` -> `cypress.config.ts` is required from any version below 10 to 10 or above. Other automated migrations might also be possible in future.

The user needs to migrate not because "they are upgrading to X" but rather "their project is in a format that Cypress no longer recognizes".

### Other

_No response_

comment.body:
The code for this is done in [cypress-io/cypress#24541](https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress/pull/24541), but has yet to be released.
We'll update this issue and reference the [changelog](https://on.cypress.io/changelog) when it's released.

issue.title: In-app information about new releases

labels.name: stage: pending release
labels.description: There is a closed PR for this issue

issue.body: This will take the following form - a full splash page in the launchpad - with exact content to be confirmed as part of this PR review. Other requirements: - This will be a “single point of entry” in the launchpad - UI is the same for all users/projects, no mention of migration, if a migration is needed, that is discovered after "Continue" - After clicking the “Continue” button the next step the user moves to is: - Migration Helper, if needed, or - Whatever the next step would have been for that user based on what browser and testingType flags they passed to cypress open - Clicking “Continue” records that the promo for this major version has been seen - We record this status as a global preference on the users machine, each user should dismiss this UI only once per major version & not see it again when updating other projects etc. Exact content is TBD - may include an illustration, may be just text. For v11, we will always show the summary of the v10 version at the bottom, even if you came from v10 - we will not attempt to separate out those who are “leapfrogging” at the moment.

issue.title: fix: hide 'open in IDE' button from command log in CT
issue.body:
<!-- Thanks for contributing! PLEASE...
- Read our contributing guidelines: https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress/blob/develop/CONTRIBUTING.md 
- Read our Code Review Checklist on coding standards and what needs to be done before a PR can be merged: https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress/blob/develop/CONTRIBUTING.md#Code-Review-Checklist
- Mark this PR as "Draft" if it is not ready for review.
- Make sure you set the correct base branch based on what packages you're changing: https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress/blob/develop/CONTRIBUTING.md#branches
-->

- Closes #24366

### User facing changelog
<!-- 
Explain the change(s) for every user to read in our changelog. Examples: https://on.cypress.io/changelog
If the change is not user-facing, write "n/a".
-->

User will no longer see "Open in IDE" in the command log for component tests

### Additional details
<!-- Examples:
- Why was this change necessary?
- What is affected by this change?
- Any implementation details to explain?
-->

This button doesn't work for CT. As a part of the GA effort, we should remove this button from CT so that users don't try to click it. We'll actually fix it and re-enable it with #24549

### Steps to test
<!--
For non-trivial behavior changes, list the steps that a reviewer should follow to validate the new behavior.
This is not meant to be the only testing performed by a reviewer, just the "happy path" that leads to the new behavior.
-->

1. Run Cypress
2. Open e2e tests
3. Run a spec
4. While the spec is running, hover over the "test body" section of the command log and verify that you still see the "Open in IDE" button on hover
5. Click the button and verify that you are taken to the spec file in your configured IDE
6. Open Component Testing
7. Run a CT spec
8. While the spec is running, hover over the same spot in the command log and verify that the "Open in IDE" button is **not** rendered

### PR Tasks
<!-- 
These tasks must be completed before a PR is merged.
If a task does not apply, write [na] instead of checking the box.
DO NOT DELETE the PR checklist.
-->

- [x] Have tests been added/updated?
- [x] Has the original issue (or this PR, if no issue exists) been tagged with a release in ZenHub? (user-facing changes only)
- [na] Has a PR for user-facing changes been opened in [`cypress-documentation`](https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress-documentation)? <!-- Link to PR here -->
- [na] Have API changes been updated in the [`type definitions`](https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress/blob/develop/cli/types/cypress.d.ts)?

labels.name: experiment: session
labels.description: Issues when using experimentalSessionSupport

labels.name: experiment: origin

issue.body:
With the addition of cy.origin and cy.session we should 

1. update cy.cookie apis to allow users to pass in the domain as an option
2. update the cy.cookie apis default to use the AUT domain as default if available

Spike into what options we have when setting cookies and the AUT is undefined.

This should affect getCookies, getCookie, setCookies, clearCookie and clearCookies.

issue.title: Marktnoonan/cy 11 migration
issue.body:
<!-- Thanks for contributing! PLEASE...
- Read our contributing guidelines: https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress/blob/develop/CONTRIBUTING.md 
- Read our Code Review Checklist on coding standards and what needs to be done before a PR can be merged: https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress/blob/develop/CONTRIBUTING.md#Code-Review-Checklist
- Mark this PR as "Draft" if it is not ready for review.
- Make sure you set the correct base branch based on what packages you're changing: https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress/blob/develop/CONTRIBUTING.md#branches
-->

- Closes #24380
- Closes #24381

### User facing changelog

Users will see a one-time Welcome screen the first time they run `cypress open` on a new major version of Cypress.

### Additional details
<!-- Examples:
- Why was this change necessary?
- What is affected by this change?
- Any implementation details to explain?
-->


The most important change is that in Cypress 10 the Welcome screen was only shown when the project needed to go through config migration, in Cypress 11 the Welcome screen will be shown to _all_ users that have not already seen it for that major version.

Clicking the "Continue" button on the Welcome screen will record that the content for that particular Major has been dismissed and the user will not see it again. This is stored as a global user preference, not at the project level.

This Welcome screen appears as the first screen in the launchpad and is blocking until it is dismissed with the "Continue" button. Regardless of whether the user is opening in global mode, project mode, or with `--testingType` and `--browser` CLI flags, this will be the first thing they see.

Clicking "Continue" always leads to the appropriate next step in the launchpad based on how Cypress was opened. These steps can be:

- migration helper 
- global page
- testing type picker 
- browser picker with browser not launched (if only `--testingType` flag was passed)
- browser picker with browser opening (if in project mode and `--testingType` and `--browser` flags were both passed)

For context when reviewing this PR, there are a few decisions to call out about how this system will work (at least, for now):

#### `LocalSettingsActions`
I've updated how `LocalSettingsActions.setPreferences` works to perform a merge with existing settings in stead of fully overwriting the properties. We took a crack at this in #23762 but didn't implement correctly. I've removed the unit test that was added in that PR since, though it passed, it was testing the wrong thing. This merge approach allows setting state in nested objects, which is important as we now have 3 kinds of objects in state.json files - `banners`, `promptsShown`, and `majorVersionWelcomeDismissed`. `promptsShown` has a custom mutation and action just for merging this property, `banners` is merged with existing state on the clientside before being set. I haven't cleaned those up here, but will do so in #23768. We can also probably simplify the overall patterns (deeper in the server) around getting/setting saved state from the file system, as discussed with @warrensplayer, as it can be pretty difficult to debug an issue in this area.

#### How we are managing the new content
This PR introduces some article-like content that's different from most of the existing content in `en-US.json`. `MajorVersionWelcome.vue` is storing that content as plain HTML instead of the i18n system so that we can be flexible with the needs of each "post". Treating this content as "rich text" in this way makes it easier to understand what is being rendered. New static text like button labels and titles have still been added to i18n.

The Welcome content needs to be updated before each major release to highlight new features and breaking changes, so there will always be some custom markup here that will change major-to-major. Most of this content isn't asserted in tests - the interactive elements are, and we have Percy snapshots of the article as a whole. 

I've added a constant `MAJOR_VERSION_FOR_CONTENT` that defines the major version number that needs to be looked up in state to see if the welcome page was dismissed. We check this a few places, including on the server before launching a browser. This constant should only change in a release branch for new major versions & allows us to set up the correct content and behavior before the version actually exists.

The other consideration here is for this content to not rely on and API & work correctly even offline, so everything user-facing is hard coded, even things like release dates that could come from `VersionsDataSource` - we know what they are, so we can put them in the code.

#### Launchpad e2e tests
Since this is a new starting point for the launchpad, all launchpad e2e tests need to deal with it in some way. Following our existing patterns I added a `cy.skipWelcome()` custom command which is called in many places after `cy.visitLaunchpad()`. It can't be fully bound up with `cy.visitLaunchpad()` since there are cases where it will not be there to be dismissed. Some tests visit the launchpad more than once & this is a good thing - on the second visit it should be reading the value stored in global preferences and not show the Welcome page. In some cases I stubbed `localSettingsApi.getPreferences` to return the state with the current major version already dismissed - which seems good but is a lot more verbose. While this is in review I'll take a look at ways to simplify this - maybe add a parameter to `visitLaunchpad`, but the main thing is the tests are functioning.


### Steps to test
<!--
For non-trivial behavior changes, list the steps that a reviewer should follow to validate the new behavior.
This is not meant to be the only testing performed by a reviewer, just the "happy path" that leads to the new behavior.
-->

That's a lot of detail but the test process is pretty quick.

**Basic Test**
- open `projects/__global__/state.json` in your favorite IDE, it should not have a `majorVersionWelcomeDismissed` property
- run `yarn dev` - Cypress should open at the launchpad and you should see the "What's New in Cypress" content
- Click the continue button - you should see the "Choose Testing Type" screen
- notice that an object that looks like this has appeared in your `state.json`: 
```json
"majorVersionWelcomeDismissed": {
    "11": 1667570082797
  }
```
- refresh the launchpad - it should not show the welcome screen

**Detailed test of state.json expectations**
- delete `majorVersionWelcomeDismissed` and refresh the launchpad - it should show the welcome screen again
- click continue as before
- `majorVersionWelcomeDismissed` should be back in the `state.json` now
- add some sibling properties and remove `"11"` from the object.
- refresh the launchpad, it should show the welcome page again
- click continue
- a new `"11"` key should be added in `majorVersionWelcomeDismissed` without blowing away the sibling properties.
- kill and restart Cypress
- you should not see the welcome screen

I suggest doing the basic+detailed test once, and just the basic test for the following situations to verify the user reaches the expected next step:

1. opening with a project and no flags
2. opening with a project and `--testingType` flag
3. opening with a project and `--testingType` and `--browser` flags
4. opening with a project that has a `cypress.json` instead of `cypress.config.ts`
5. opening in global mode

Also tab to the continue button and makes sure you can use it with space and enter keys - keyboard access to dismiss a fully-blocking state is essential.


### How has the user experience changed?
<!-- Provide before and after examples of the change.
Screenshots or GIFs are preferred. -->




### PR Tasks
<!-- 
These tasks must be completed before a PR is merged.
If a task does not apply, write [na] instead of checking the box.
DO NOT DELETE the PR checklist.
-->

- [ ] Have tests been added/updated?
- [ ] Has the original issue (or this PR, if no issue exists) been tagged with a release in ZenHub? (user-facing changes only)
- [ ] Has a PR for user-facing changes been opened in [`cypress-documentation`](https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress-documentation)? <!-- Link to PR here -->
- [ ] Have API changes been updated in the [`type definitions`](https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress/blob/develop/cli/types/cypress.d.ts)?

issue.title: Removal of erraneous functionality in CT

labels.name: stage: pending release
labels.description: There is a closed PR for this issue

labels.name: CT
labels.description: The CT team is responsible for this issue.

labels.name: ct-core
labels.description: Component Testing ecosystem related issues

issue.body:
We want to remove functionality that was deemed as erraneous with regards to critical functionality in Component Testing. Use the `no-dead-code` paradigm when practical to ensure users don't experience unnecessary blockers. 

## Things that need to be removed

### Global
- deprecate style injections (including impl in `mount-utils`).

### React
- `mountHook` function
- `unmount` function should no longer be exported
- Auto aliasing of mounted component

### Vue
- Remove mount callback

issue.title: cy.mount should remove the last mounted component if called multiple times in same test

labels.name: stage: pending release
labels.description: There is a closed PR for this issue

labels.name: CT
labels.description: The CT team is responsible for this issue.

labels.name: ct-core
labels.description: Component Testing ecosystem related issues

issue.body:
### Current behavior

Scenario:

```ts
it('calls mount twice', () => {
  cy.mount(MyApp)
  cy.mount(MyApp)
})
```

Framework dependent behavior:

- Angular: Throws error upon second mount
- Vue: Mounts multiple components
- Svelte: Mounts multiple components
- React: Removes and remounts
- Vue2: Mounts multiple components

### Desired behavior

The last component mounted should be removed from the DOM/cleaned up.

### Test code to reproduce

```ts
import HelloWorld from "./components/HelloWorld.vue";

it("default", () => {
  cy.mount(HelloWorld, { props: { msg: "Component 1" } });
  cy.mount(HelloWorld, { props: { msg: "Component 2" } });
  cy.mount(HelloWorld, { props: { msg: "Component 3" } });
});
```

![Screen Shot 2022-10-20 at 5 11 51 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25158820/197068902-3339c4e4-f49f-48da-a5a7-5a842a06c021.png)


### Cypress Version

10.10.0

### Node version

v16.17.1

### Operating System

macOS 12.4

### Debug Logs

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

issue.title: Fix Recovered Error Handling and Session Recovered Errors
issue.body:
- Closes #21398
- Closes #24205

There PR has a few set of changes going on:
- Correct `cy.session()` error messaging for both created and restored/created with test coverage
	- updated messaging
	- proper code frames
	- handles the following failed validation scenarios: yield false, rejects, resolve false, thrown cy command, thrown err
- Fix Session Instrument Panel Tag color
- Enhance `cy.session()` console props output to include sessionStorage details and add step information to help with debuggin
- Fix verifying upcoming assertions log handling (and associated tests) - this was need to prevent duplicate error logging in recreated sessions
- Update command queue to be recursive to allow queue failures to always be collected when `onQueueFailed` (previously `onCommandFailed`) to ensure all failures can be collected on a 2nd session validation failure and/or when multiple session commands are used in a test.
- Correctly end log groups when `on:fail` handlers to make additional assertions visible 

### User facing changelog
TO DO

### Steps to test
It would be solid to pull this branch down and run various tests yourself to verify changes to logs and to ensure we don't hanging logs and that things appear to be correct. 

### How has the user experience changed?
Will comment screenshots here & throughout the code. 

### PR Tasks
- [x] Have tests been added/updated?
- [x] Has the original issue (or this PR, if no issue exists) been tagged with a release in ZenHub? (user-facing changes only)

- [n/a] Have API changes been updated in the [`type definitions`](https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress/blob/develop/cli/types/cypress.d.ts)?

labels.name: stage: pending release

issue.body:
### Current behavior

Clicking "Open in IDE"  in the reporter does not take user to hook/test definition that ran.

In Prod - this does nothing. It doesn't open the IDE or launch to the file that ran. See video:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14099737/197545580-7280e228-7018-438c-9077-436ece1fe3d0.mov

In dev - this opens to the current IDE / branch & opens the stack_utils file in the driver. See video:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14099737/197545624-5512a12a-2a74-43f4-b6e8-0e9d52aa2907.mov


### Desired behavior

Opens to hook / test when "Open in IDE" is clicked.

### Test code to reproduce

Open any CT test and click "Open in IDE" after test runs.

### Cypress Version

10.10.0

### Node version

16.16.0

### Operating System

MacOS 12.5.1

### Debug Logs

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

issue.title: Updated Migration UI for Cy 11+

labels.name: stage: pending release
labels.description: There is a closed PR for this issue

issue.body:
### What would you like?

We need to split out version specific content like "Welcome to Cypress 10!" from the information that users need to perform a migration before they they can launch the latest Cypress.

Designs are WIP but this would be a straight replacement of this screen in v10 with something more generic explaining the need to migrate:

![Screen Shot 2022-10-25 at 10 26 19 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8340719/197800785-a2310e73-579a-4725-88dc-7eb83e665cbc.png)


### Why is this needed?

The reason for this is that migration of `cypress.json` -> `cypress.config.ts` is required from any version below 10 to 10 or above. Other automated migrations might also be possible in future.

The user needs to migrate not because "they are upgrading to X" but rather "their project is in a format that Cypress no longer recognizes".

### Other

_No response_

comment.body:
The code for this is done in [cypress-io/cypress#24541](https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress/pull/24541), but has yet to be released.
We'll update this issue and reference the [changelog](https://on.cypress.io/changelog) when it's released.

issue.title: In-app information about new releases

labels.name: stage: pending release
labels.description: There is a closed PR for this issue

issue.body: This will take the following form - a full splash page in the launchpad - with exact content to be confirmed as part of this PR review. Other requirements: - This will be a “single point of entry” in the launchpad - UI is the same for all users/projects, no mention of migration, if a migration is needed, that is discovered after "Continue" - After clicking the “Continue” button the next step the user moves to is: - Migration Helper, if needed, or - Whatever the next step would have been for that user based on what browser and testingType flags they passed to cypress open - Clicking “Continue” records that the promo for this major version has been seen - We record this status as a global preference on the users machine, each user should dismiss this UI only once per major version & not see it again when updating other projects etc. Exact content is TBD - may include an illustration, may be just text. For v11, we will always show the summary of the v10 version at the bottom, even if you came from v10 - we will not attempt to separate out those who are “leapfrogging” at the moment.

issue.body:
<!-- Thanks for contributing! PLEASE...
- Read our contributing guidelines: https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress/blob/develop/CONTRIBUTING.md 
- Read our Code Review Checklist on coding standards and what needs to be done before a PR can be merged: https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress/blob/develop/CONTRIBUTING.md#Code-Review-Checklist

-->

- Closes #24366

### User facing changelog
<!-- 
Explain the change(s) for every user to read in our changelog. Examples: https://on.cypress.io/changelog
If the change is not user-facing, write "n/a".
-->

User will no longer see "Open in IDE" in the command log for component tests

### Additional details
<!-- Examples:
- Why was this change necessary?
- What is affected by this change?
- Any implementation details to explain?
-->

This button doesn't work for CT. As a part of the GA effort, we should remove this button from CT so that users don't try to click it. We'll actually fix it and re-enable it with #24549

### Steps to test
<!--
For non-trivial behavior changes, list the steps that a reviewer should follow to validate the new behavior.
This is not meant to be the only testing performed by a reviewer, just the "happy path" that leads to the new behavior.
-->

1. Run Cypress
2. Open e2e tests
3. Run a spec
4. While the spec is running, hover over the "test body" section of the command log and verify that you still see the "Open in IDE" button on hover
5. Click the button and verify that you are taken to the spec file in your configured IDE
6. Open Component Testing
7. Run a CT spec
8. While the spec is running, hover over the same spot in the command log and verify that the "Open in IDE" button is **not** rendered

### PR Tasks
<!-- 
These tasks must be completed before a PR is merged.
If a task does not apply, write [na] instead of checking the box.
DO NOT DELETE the PR checklist.

labels.name: experiment: session
labels.description: Issues when using experimentalSessionSupport

labels.name: experiment: origin
labels.description: Issues when using experimentalSessionAndOrigin

issue.body:
With the addition of cy.origin and cy.session we should 

1. update cy.cookie apis to allow users to pass in the domain as an option
2. update the cy.cookie apis default to use the AUT domain as default if available

Spike into what options we have when setting cookies and the AUT is undefined.

This should affect getCookies, getCookie, setCookies, clearCookie and clearCookies.

issue.title: Marktnoonan/cy 11 migration
issue.body:
<!-- Thanks for contributing! PLEASE...
- Read our contributing guidelines: https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress/blob/develop/CONTRIBUTING.md 
- Read our Code Review Checklist on coding standards and what needs to be done before a PR can be merged: https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress/blob/develop/CONTRIBUTING.md#Code-Review-Checklist
- Mark this PR as "Draft" if it is not ready for review.
- Make sure you set the correct base branch based on what packages you're changing: https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress/blob/develop/CONTRIBUTING.md#branches
-->

- Closes #24380
- Closes #24381

### User facing changelog

Users will see a one-time Welcome screen the first time they run `cypress open` on a new major version of Cypress.

### Additional details
<!-- Examples:
- Why was this change necessary?
- What is affected by this change?
- Any implementation details to explain?
-->


The most important change is that in Cypress 10 the Welcome screen was only shown when the project needed to go through config migration, in Cypress 11 the Welcome screen will be shown to _all_ users that have not already seen it for that major version.

Clicking the "Continue" button on the Welcome screen will record that the content for that particular Major has been dismissed and the user will not see it again. This is stored as a global user preference, not at the project level.

This Welcome screen appears as the first screen in the launchpad and is blocking until it is dismissed with the "Continue" button. Regardless of whether the user is opening in global mode, project mode, or with `--testingType` and `--browser` CLI flags, this will be the first thing they see.

Clicking "Continue" always leads to the appropriate next step in the launchpad based on how Cypress was opened. These steps can be:

- migration helper 
- global page
- testing type picker 
- browser picker with browser not launched (if only `--testingType` flag was passed)
- browser picker with browser opening (if in project mode and `--testingType` and `--browser` flags were both passed)

For context when reviewing this PR, there are a few decisions to call out about how this system will work (at least, for now):

#### `LocalSettingsActions`
I've updated how `LocalSettingsActions.setPreferences` works to perform a merge with existing settings in stead of fully overwriting the properties. We took a crack at this in #23762 but didn't implement correctly. I've removed the unit test that was added in that PR since, though it passed, it was testing the wrong thing. This merge approach allows setting state in nested objects, which is important as we now have 3 kinds of objects in state.json files - `banners`, `promptsShown`, and `majorVersionWelcomeDismissed`. `promptsShown` has a custom mutation and action just for merging this property, `banners` is merged with existing state on the clientside before being set. I haven't cleaned those up here, but will do so in #23768. We can also probably simplify the overall patterns (deeper in the server) around getting/setting saved state from the file system, as discussed with @warrensplayer, as it can be pretty difficult to debug an issue in this area.

#### How we are managing the new content
This PR introduces some article-like content that's different from most of the existing content in `en-US.json`. `MajorVersionWelcome.vue` is storing that content as plain HTML instead of the i18n system so that we can be flexible with the needs of each "post". Treating this content as "rich text" in this way makes it easier to understand what is being rendered. New static text like button labels and titles have still been added to i18n.

The Welcome content needs to be updated before each major release to highlight new features and breaking changes, so there will always be some custom markup here that will change major-to-major. Most of this content isn't asserted in tests - the interactive elements are, and we have Percy snapshots of the article as a whole. 

I've added a constant `MAJOR_VERSION_FOR_CONTENT` that defines the major version number that needs to be looked up in state to see if the welcome page was dismissed. We check this a few places, including on the server before launching a browser. This constant should only change in a release branch for new major versions & allows us to set up the correct content and behavior before the version actually exists.

The other consideration here is for this content to not rely on and API & work correctly even offline, so everything user-facing is hard coded, even things like release dates that could come from `VersionsDataSource` - we know what they are, so we can put them in the code.

#### Launchpad e2e tests
Since this is a new starting point for the launchpad, all launchpad e2e tests need to deal with it in some way. Following our existing patterns I added a `cy.skipWelcome()` custom command which is called in many places after `cy.visitLaunchpad()`. It can't be fully bound up with `cy.visitLaunchpad()` since there are cases where it will not be there to be dismissed. Some tests visit the launchpad more than once & this is a good thing - on the second visit it should be reading the value stored in global preferences and not show the Welcome page. In some cases I stubbed `localSettingsApi.getPreferences` to return the state with the current major version already dismissed - which seems good but is a lot more verbose. While this is in review I'll take a look at ways to simplify this - maybe add a parameter to `visitLaunchpad`, but the main thing is the tests are functioning.


### Steps to test
<!--
For non-trivial behavior changes, list the steps that a reviewer should follow to validate the new behavior.
This is not meant to be the only testing performed by a reviewer, just the "happy path" that leads to the new behavior.
-->

That's a lot of detail but the test process is pretty quick.

**Basic Test**
- open `projects/__global__/state.json` in your favorite IDE, it should not have a `majorVersionWelcomeDismissed` property
- run `yarn dev` - Cypress should open at the launchpad and you should see the "What's New in Cypress" content
- Click the continue button - you should see the "Choose Testing Type" screen
- notice that an object that looks like this has appeared in your `state.json`: 
```json
"majorVersionWelcomeDismissed": {
    "11": 1667570082797
  }
```
- refresh the launchpad - it should not show the welcome screen

**Detailed test of state.json expectations**
- delete `majorVersionWelcomeDismissed` and refresh the launchpad - it should show the welcome screen again
- click continue as before
- `majorVersionWelcomeDismissed` should be back in the `state.json` now
- add some sibling properties and remove `"11"` from the object.
- refresh the launchpad, it should show the welcome page again
- click continue
- a new `"11"` key should be added in `majorVersionWelcomeDismissed` without blowing away the sibling properties.
- kill and restart Cypress
- you should not see the welcome screen

I suggest doing the basic+detailed test once, and just the basic test for the following situations to verify the user reaches the expected next step:

1. opening with a project and no flags
2. opening with a project and `--testingType` flag
3. opening with a project and `--testingType` and `--browser` flags
4. opening with a project that has a `cypress.json` instead of `cypress.config.ts`
5. opening in global mode

Also tab to the continue button and makes sure you can use it with space and enter keys - keyboard access to dismiss a fully-blocking state is essential.


### How has the user experience changed?
<!-- Provide before and after examples of the change.
Screenshots or GIFs are preferred. -->




### PR Tasks
<!-- 
These tasks must be completed before a PR is merged.
If a task does not apply, write [na] instead of checking the box.
DO NOT DELETE the PR checklist.
-->

- [ ] Have tests been added/updated?
- [ ] Has the original issue (or this PR, if no issue exists) been tagged with a release in ZenHub? (user-facing changes only)
- [ ] Has a PR for user-facing changes been opened in [`cypress-documentation`](https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress-documentation)? <!-- Link to PR here -->
- [ ] Have API changes been updated in the [`type definitions`](https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress/blob/develop/cli/types/cypress.d.ts)?

issue.title: Removal of erraneous functionality in CT

labels.name: stage: pending release
labels.description: There is a closed PR for this issue

labels.name: CT
labels.description: The CT team is responsible for this issue.

labels.name: ct-core
labels.description: Component Testing ecosystem related issues

issue.body:
We want to remove functionality that was deemed as erraneous with regards to critical functionality in Component Testing. Use the `no-dead-code` paradigm when practical to ensure users don't experience unnecessary blockers. 

## Things that need to be removed

### Global
- deprecate style injections (including impl in `mount-utils`).

### React
- `mountHook` function
- `unmount` function should no longer be exported
- Auto aliasing of mounted component

### Vue
- Remove mount callback

issue.title: cy.mount should remove the last mounted component if called multiple times in same test

labels.name: stage: pending release
labels.description: There is a closed PR for this issue

labels.name: CT
labels.description: The CT team is responsible for this issue.

labels.name: ct-core
labels.description: Component Testing ecosystem related issues

issue.body:
### Current behavior

Scenario:

```ts
it('calls mount twice', () => {
  cy.mount(MyApp)
  cy.mount(MyApp)
})
```

Framework dependent behavior:

- Angular: Throws error upon second mount
- Vue: Mounts multiple components
- Svelte: Mounts multiple components
- React: Removes and remounts
- Vue2: Mounts multiple components

### Desired behavior

The last component mounted should be removed from the DOM/cleaned up.

### Test code to reproduce

```ts
import HelloWorld from "./components/HelloWorld.vue";

it("default", () => {
  cy.mount(HelloWorld, { props: { msg: "Component 1" } });
  cy.mount(HelloWorld, { props: { msg: "Component 2" } });
  cy.mount(HelloWorld, { props: { msg: "Component 3" } });
});
```

![Screen Shot 2022-10-20 at 5 11 51 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25158820/197068902-3339c4e4-f49f-48da-a5a7-5a842a06c021.png)


### Cypress Version

10.10.0

### Node version

v16.17.1

### Operating System

macOS 12.4

### Debug Logs

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

issue.title: Fix Recovered Error Handling and Session Recovered Errors
issue.body:
- Closes #21398
- Closes #24205

There PR has a few set of changes going on:
- Correct `cy.session()` error messaging for both created and restored/created with test coverage
	- updated messaging
	- proper code frames
	- handles the following failed validation scenarios: yield false, rejects, resolve false, thrown cy command, thrown err
- Fix Session Instrument Panel Tag color
- Enhance `cy.session()` console props output to include sessionStorage details and add step information to help with debuggin
- Fix verifying upcoming assertions log handling (and associated tests) - this was need to prevent duplicate error logging in recreated sessions
- Update command queue to be recursive to allow queue failures to always be collected when `onQueueFailed` (previously `onCommandFailed`) to ensure all failures can be collected on a 2nd session validation failure and/or when multiple session commands are used in a test.
- Correctly end log groups when `on:fail` handlers to make additional assertions visible 

### User facing changelog
TO DO

### Steps to test
It would be solid to pull this branch down and run various tests yourself to verify changes to logs and to ensure we don't hanging logs and that things appear to be correct. 

### How has the user experience changed?
Will comment screenshots here & throughout the code. 

### PR Tasks
- [x] Have tests been added/updated?
- [x] Has the original issue (or this PR, if no issue exists) been tagged with a release in ZenHub? (user-facing changes only)
- [TODO] Has a PR for user-facing changes been opened in [`cypress-documentation`](https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress-documentation)? <!-- Link to PR here -->
- [n/a] Have API changes been updated in the [`type definitions`](https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress/blob/develop/cli/types/cypress.d.ts)?

issue.title: Updated Migration UI for Cy 11+

labels.name: stage: pending release
labels.description: There is a closed PR for this issue

issue.body:
### What would you like?

We need to split out version specific content like "Welcome to Cypress 10!" from the information that users need to perform a migration before they they can launch the latest Cypress.

Designs are WIP but this would be a straight replacement of this screen in v10 with something more generic explaining the need to migrate:

![Screen Shot 2022-10-25 at 10 26 19 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8340719/197800785-a2310e73-579a-4725-88dc-7eb83e665cbc.png)


### Why is this needed?

The reason for this is that migration of `cypress.json` -> `cypress.config.ts` is required from any version below 10 to 10 or above. Other automated migrations might also be possible in future.

The user needs to migrate not because "they are upgrading to X" but rather "their project is in a format that Cypress no longer recognizes".

### Other

_No response_

comment.body:
The code for this is done in [cypress-io/cypress#24541](https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress/pull/24541), but has yet to be released.
We'll update this issue and reference the [changelog](https://on.cypress.io/changelog) when it's released.

issue.title: In-app information about new releases

labels.name: stage: pending release
labels.description: There is a closed PR for this issue

issue.body: This will take the following form - a full splash page in the launchpad - with exact content to be confirmed as part of this PR review. Other requirements: - This will be a “single point of entry” in the launchpad - UI is the same for all users/projects, no mention of migration, if a migration is needed, that is discovered after "Continue" - After clicking the “Continue” button the next step the user moves to is: - Migration Helper, if needed, or - Whatever the next step would have been for that user based on what browser and testingType flags they passed to cypress open - Clicking “Continue” records that the promo for this major version has been seen - We record this status as a global preference on the users machine, each user should dismiss this UI only once per major version & not see it again when updating other projects etc. Exact content is TBD - may include an illustration, may be just text. For v11, we will always show the summary of the v10 version at the bottom, even if you came from v10 - we will not attempt to separate out those who are “leapfrogging” at the moment.

issue.body:
<!-- Thanks for contributing! PLEASE...
- Read our contributing guidelines: https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress/blob/develop/CONTRIBUTING.md 
- Read our Code Review Checklist on coding standards and what needs to be done before a PR can be merged: https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress/blob/develop/CONTRIBUTING.md#Code-Review-Checklist
- Mark this PR as "Draft" if it is not ready for review.
- Make sure you set the correct base branch based on what packages you're changing: https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress/blob/develop/CONTRIBUTING.md#branches
-->

- Closes #24366

### User facing changelog
<!-- 
Explain the change(s) for every user to read in our changelog. Examples: https://on.cypress.io/changelog
If the change is not user-facing, write "n/a".
-->

User will no longer see "Open in IDE" in the command log for component tests

### Additional details
<!-- Examples:
- Why was this change necessary?
- What is affected by this change?
- Any implementation details to explain?
-->

This button doesn't work for CT. As a part of the GA effort, we should remove this button from CT so that users don't try to click it. We'll actually fix it and re-enable it with #24549

### Steps to test
<!--
For non-trivial behavior changes, list the steps that a reviewer should follow to validate the new behavior.
This is not meant to be the only testing performed by a reviewer, just the "happy path" that leads to the new behavior.
-->

1. Run Cypress
2. Open e2e tests
3. Run a spec
4. While the spec is running, hover over the "test body" section of the command log and verify that you still see the "Open in IDE" button on hover
5. Click the button and verify that you are taken to the spec file in your configured IDE
6. Open Component Testing
7. Run a CT spec
8. While the spec is running, hover over the same spot in the command log and verify that the "Open in IDE" button is **not** rendered

### PR Tasks
<!-- 
These tasks must be completed before a PR is merged.
If a task does not apply, write [na] instead of checking the box.
DO NOT DELETE the PR checklist.

issue.title: Marktnoonan/cy 11 migration
issue.body:
<!-- Thanks for contributing! PLEASE...
- Read our contributing guidelines: https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress/blob/develop/CONTRIBUTING.md 
- Read our Code Review Checklist on coding standards and what needs to be done before a PR can be merged: https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress/blob/develop/CONTRIBUTING.md#Code-Review-Checklist
- Mark this PR as "Draft" if it is not ready for review.
- Make sure you set the correct base branch based on what packages you're changing: https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress/blob/develop/CONTRIBUTING.md#branches
-->

- Closes #24380
- Closes #24381

### User facing changelog

Users will see a one-time Welcome screen the first time they run `cypress open` on a new major version of Cypress.

### Additional details
<!-- Examples:
- Why was this change necessary?
- What is affected by this change?
- Any implementation details to explain?
-->


The most important change is that in Cypress 10 the Welcome screen was only shown when the project needed to go through config migration, in Cypress 11 the Welcome screen will be shown to _all_ users that have not already seen it for that major version.

Clicking the "Continue" button on the Welcome screen will record that the content for that particular Major has been dismissed and the user will not see it again. This is stored as a global user preference, not at the project level.

This Welcome screen appears as the first screen in the launchpad and is blocking until it is dismissed with the "Continue" button. Regardless of whether the user is opening in global mode, project mode, or with `--testingType` and `--browser` CLI flags, this will be the first thing they see.

Clicking "Continue" always leads to the appropriate next step in the launchpad based on how Cypress was opened. These steps can be:

- migration helper 
- global page
- testing type picker 
- browser picker with browser not launched (if only `--testingType` flag was passed)
- browser picker with browser opening (if in project mode and `--testingType` and `--browser` flags were both passed)

For context when reviewing this PR, there are a few decisions to call out about how this system will work (at least, for now):

#### `LocalSettingsActions`
I've updated how `LocalSettingsActions.setPreferences` works to perform a merge with existing settings in stead of fully overwriting the properties. We took a crack at this in #23762 but didn't implement correctly. I've removed the unit test that was added in that PR since, though it passed, it was testing the wrong thing. This merge approach allows setting state in nested objects, which is important as we now have 3 kinds of objects in state.json files - `banners`, `promptsShown`, and `majorVersionWelcomeDismissed`. `promptsShown` has a custom mutation and action just for merging this property, `banners` is merged with existing state on the clientside before being set. I haven't cleaned those up here, but will do so in #23768. We can also probably simplify the overall patterns (deeper in the server) around getting/setting saved state from the file system, as discussed with @warrensplayer, as it can be pretty difficult to debug an issue in this area.

#### How we are managing the new content
This PR introduces some article-like content that's different from most of the existing content in `en-US.json`. `MajorVersionWelcome.vue` is storing that content as plain HTML instead of the i18n system so that we can be flexible with the needs of each "post". Treating this content as "rich text" in this way makes it easier to understand what is being rendered. New static text like button labels and titles have still been added to i18n.

The Welcome content needs to be updated before each major release to highlight new features and breaking changes, so there will always be some custom markup here that will change major-to-major. Most of this content isn't asserted in tests - the interactive elements are, and we have Percy snapshots of the article as a whole. 

I've added a constant `MAJOR_VERSION_FOR_CONTENT` that defines the major version number that needs to be looked up in state to see if the welcome page was dismissed. We check this a few places, including on the server before launching a browser. This constant should only change in a release branch for new major versions & allows us to set up the correct content and behavior before the version actually exists.

The other consideration here is for this content to not rely on and API & work correctly even offline, so everything user-facing is hard coded, even things like release dates that could come from `VersionsDataSource` - we know what they are, so we can put them in the code.

#### Launchpad e2e tests
Since this is a new starting point for the launchpad, all launchpad e2e tests need to deal with it in some way. Following our existing patterns I added a `cy.skipWelcome()` custom command which is called in many places after `cy.visitLaunchpad()`. It can't be fully bound up with `cy.visitLaunchpad()` since there are cases where it will not be there to be dismissed. Some tests visit the launchpad more than once & this is a good thing - on the second visit it should be reading the value stored in global preferences and not show the Welcome page. In some cases I stubbed `localSettingsApi.getPreferences` to return the state with the current major version already dismissed - which seems good but is a lot more verbose. While this is in review I'll take a look at ways to simplify this - maybe add a parameter to `visitLaunchpad`, but the main thing is the tests are functioning.


### Steps to test
<!--
For non-trivial behavior changes, list the steps that a reviewer should follow to validate the new behavior.
This is not meant to be the only testing performed by a reviewer, just the "happy path" that leads to the new behavior.
-->

That's a lot of detail but the test process is pretty quick.

**Basic Test**
- open `projects/__global__/state.json` in your favorite IDE, it should not have a `majorVersionWelcomeDismissed` property
- run `yarn dev` - Cypress should open at the launchpad and you should see the "What's New in Cypress" content
- Click the continue button - you should see the "Choose Testing Type" screen
- notice that an object that looks like this has appeared in your `state.json`: 
```json
"majorVersionWelcomeDismissed": {
    "11": 1667570082797
  }
```
- refresh the launchpad - it should not show the welcome screen

**Detailed test of state.json expectations**
- delete `majorVersionWelcomeDismissed` and refresh the launchpad - it should show the welcome screen again
- click continue as before
- `majorVersionWelcomeDismissed` should be back in the `state.json` now
- add some sibling properties and remove `"11"` from the object.
- refresh the launchpad, it should show the welcome page again
- click continue
- a new `"11"` key should be added in `majorVersionWelcomeDismissed` without blowing away the sibling properties.
- kill and restart Cypress
- you should not see the welcome screen

I suggest doing the basic+detailed test once, and just the basic test for the following situations to verify the user reaches the expected next step:

1. opening with a project and no flags
2. opening with a project and `--testingType` flag
3. opening with a project and `--testingType` and `--browser` flags
4. opening with a project that has a `cypress.json` instead of `cypress.config.ts`
5. opening in global mode

Also tab to the continue button and makes sure you can use it with space and enter keys - keyboard access to dismiss a fully-blocking state is essential.


### How has the user experience changed?
<!-- Provide before and after examples of the change.
Screenshots or GIFs are preferred. -->




### PR Tasks
<!-- 
These tasks must be completed before a PR is merged.
If a task does not apply, write [na] instead of checking the box.
DO NOT DELETE the PR checklist.
-->

- [ ] Have tests been added/updated?
- [ ] Has the original issue (or this PR, if no issue exists) been tagged with a release in ZenHub? (user-facing changes only)
- [ ] Has a PR for user-facing changes been opened in [`cypress-documentation`](https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress-documentation)? <!-- Link to PR here -->
- [ ] Have API changes been updated in the [`type definitions`](https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress/blob/develop/cli/types/cypress.d.ts)?

issue.title: Removal of erraneous functionality in CT

labels.name: stage: pending release
labels.description: There is a closed PR for this issue

labels.name: CT
labels.description: The CT team is responsible for this issue.

labels.name: ct-core
labels.description: Component Testing ecosystem related issues

issue.body:
We want to remove functionality that was deemed as erraneous with regards to critical functionality in Component Testing. Use the `no-dead-code` paradigm when practical to ensure users don't experience unnecessary blockers. 

## Things that need to be removed

### Global
- deprecate style injections (including impl in `mount-utils`).

### React
- `mountHook` function
- `unmount` function should no longer be exported
- Auto aliasing of mounted component

### Vue
- Remove mount callback

issue.title: cy.mount should remove the last mounted component if called multiple times in same test

labels.name: stage: pending release
labels.description: There is a closed PR for this issue

labels.name: CT
labels.description: The CT team is responsible for this issue.

labels.name: ct-core
labels.description: Component Testing ecosystem related issues

issue.body:
### Current behavior

Scenario:

```ts
it('calls mount twice', () => {
  cy.mount(MyApp)
  cy.mount(MyApp)
})
```

Framework dependent behavior:

- Angular: Throws error upon second mount
- Vue: Mounts multiple components
- Svelte: Mounts multiple components
- React: Removes and remounts
- Vue2: Mounts multiple components

### Desired behavior

The last component mounted should be removed from the DOM/cleaned up.

### Test code to reproduce

```ts
import HelloWorld from "./components/HelloWorld.vue";

it("default", () => {
  cy.mount(HelloWorld, { props: { msg: "Component 1" } });
  cy.mount(HelloWorld, { props: { msg: "Component 2" } });
  cy.mount(HelloWorld, { props: { msg: "Component 3" } });
});
```

![Screen Shot 2022-10-20 at 5 11 51 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25158820/197068902-3339c4e4-f49f-48da-a5a7-5a842a06c021.png)


### Cypress Version

10.10.0

### Node version

v16.17.1

### Operating System

macOS 12.4

### Debug Logs

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

issue.title: Fix Recovered Error Handling and Session Recovered Errors
issue.body:
- Closes #21398
- Closes #24205

There PR has a few set of changes going on:
- Correct `cy.session()` error messaging for both created and restored/created with test coverage
	- updated messaging
	- proper code frames
	- handles the following failed validation scenarios: yield false, rejects, resolve false, thrown cy command, thrown err
- Fix Session Instrument Panel Tag color
- Enhance `cy.session()` console props output to include sessionStorage details and add step information to help with debuggin
- Fix verifying upcoming assertions log handling (and associated tests) - this was need to prevent duplicate error logging in recreated sessions
- Update command queue to be recursive to allow queue failures to always be collected when `onQueueFailed` (previously `onCommandFailed`) to ensure all failures can be collected on a 2nd session validation failure and/or when multiple session commands are used in a test.
- Correctly end log groups when `on:fail` handlers to make additional assertions visible 

### User facing changelog
TO DO

### Steps to test
It would be solid to pull this branch down and run various tests yourself to verify changes to logs and to ensure we don't hanging logs and that things appear to be correct. 

### How has the user experience changed?
Will comment screenshots here & throughout the code. 

### PR Tasks
- [x] Have tests been added/updated?
- [x] Has the original issue (or this PR, if no issue exists) been tagged with a release in ZenHub? (user-facing changes only)

issue.body: ## Current Behavior When hovering over `mount` in the command log of a component test, the AUT shows a blank white view instead of the mounted component. ## Desired Behavior The mount command shows the mounted component in the AUT
